DataElement.preferredName: Somatic Mutation Finding Change Codon Number java.lang.Long
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A mutation that occurs in the somatic tissues of an organism and that will not, therefore, be heritable, since it is not present in the germ line. Somatic mutations may contribute to a disease state.:Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom)._The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A specific sequence of three adjacent bases on a strand of DNA or RNA that provides genetic code information for a particular amino acid.:A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification._Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is a long integer (64-bit two's complement).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A mutation that occurs in the somatic tissues of an organism and that will not, therefore, be heritable, since it is not present in the germ line. Somatic mutations may contribute to a disease state.:Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).

Concepts.definition: Any mutation with an origin in cells that are not destined to become gametes. As a consequence, such mutations are not transmitted to progeny, though they will be transmitted during any mitosis within the individual. Somatic mutations may contribute to a broad variety of pathologies including cancer.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:A specific sequence of three adjacent bases on a strand of DNA or RNA that provides genetic code information for a particular amino acid.:A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

Concepts.definition: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
A specific sequence of three adjacent bases on a strand of DNA or RNA that provides genetic code information for a particular amino acid.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Generic value domain for a primitive java dataype that is a long integer (64-bit two's complement).

ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: 10.14.20 TL changed WFS from DRAFT NEW to RETIRED ARCHIVED and added an End Date in preparation of OneData.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
